TopicTitle: The K Prize - 100% reusable spaceplane to orbit and back

Articles.Content:
Crashing through the gates to this party with "Swallow"

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ZDkwkM4hMDg?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

(Sorry Booly, just can't do stock aerodynamics anymore ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif) )

**Edited <time datetime="2014-08-15T13:49:51Z" title="08/15/2014 01:49  PM" data-short="9 yr">August 15, 2014</time> by WafflesToo**
  
got the planes name wrong, doofus...

I suppose I should swing by and claim my k-prize.

![EEtestorbit1_zps46dacd83.jpg](http://i52.photobucket.com/albums/g13/GoSlash27/KSP/EEtestorbit1_zps46dacd83.jpg)

![EEtestorbit2_zpsc52fec87.jpg](http://i52.photobucket.com/albums/g13/GoSlash27/KSP/EEtestorbit2_zpsc52fec87.jpg)

[http://wikisend.com/download/448306/EVE%20express.craft](http://wikisend.com/download/448306/EVE%20express.craft)

This little vehicle comes equipped with a pressurized capsule for 1 crew member and a clamp-o-tron jr. for docking and refueling. It does SSTO easily from Kerbin, and my goal is to make it SSTO from Eve as well.

It weighs 2.2 tons, has enough DV to fly direct to any other body with an atmosphere, and can dock in orbit or land on the runway.

Best,

-Slashy

**Edited <time datetime="2014-08-15T10:55:30Z" title="08/15/2014 10:55  AM" data-short="9 yr">August 15, 2014</time> by GoSlash27**

Hi, i'd like to to submit one more entry ![:o](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_ohmy.png)]

Astro-Cruiser again...

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/G_K48HawsIg?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

[**Craft file**](https://www.dropbox.com/s/9jc8ry6ywri4bq2/Astro-Cruiser.zip)

> 
> **To Moho and back with landing on SSTO**
> I made it ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif), after several unlucky tries, Jeb made round-trip to Moho on space plane "**Arctic tern**"
> 
> Brief stats:
> 
> Start mass/dry mass - 31.22 t / 9.36 t
> 
> Details - 107
> 
> Crew - 1 brave kerbonaut
> 
> Engines: 2 turbojets (4 intakes per engine) + 1 atomic engine
> 
> dV on LKO - 8700+ m/s
> 
> http://imgur.com/a/TcfQC#0[http://i.imgur.com/6UFgL59.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/6UFgL59.jpg)
> 
> (for details, click on picture)

Dang...! **. \_ .** no one can compete with you can they...

Moho was my next target, but i still haven't figured out a good Eve fly-by maneuver x-D 

didn't think about getting captured. Very clever.

Here's my submission! Spaceplane took off from the runway, achieved a 133km x 133km orbit, then came back around and landed on the runway. Engineer/MechJeb used only for informational displays. All parts are stock, as are the aerodynamics. Other mods were visual-only. 

Parts: 77

Mass: 18.4 tons (before launch, rounded to tenths)

Cost: 61506

![LJodyTv.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/LJodyTv.jpg)

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/DXvwI)

**Edited <time datetime="2014-08-16T14:26:33Z" title="08/16/2014 02:26  PM" data-short="9 yr">August 16, 2014</time> by NecroBones**

Yeah I'd like to include my little Roger Rrescue -![mH22q33.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/mH22q33.jpg) Finished the tech tree ages ago but this little dude is so much fun to fly I cant stop using it

[More pics here](http://imgur.com/a/9IJLN#0)

All Stock just visual mods cost 36621 part count 55

So Kando, I like the look of your technicolor ship collection, unless I am mistaken the album doesn't seem to show a complete mission and you have not stated that you did. So your word is good and I just need to know if you claim the K-Prize, i.e. have you taken off, made orbit and landed safely?

Congratulations and thanks also to NecroBones, Overfloater and Mesklin for your K-Prize mission reports. Logged and linked.

WafflesToo you are right that is definitely a gatecrasher! The robotic look worked though.

GoSlash27, did that land safely? (second screen has a preflight timecode FYI)

It'snorocketscience, your enthusiasm is welcome and I won't take offence if you want to create a related challenge building on the K-Prize theme ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) also I am happy to be consulted by PM and discuss ideas for such with anyone who wants to do that, though if you want to use the badge art you will have to talk to WafflesToo, who kindly made and donated the K-Prize badges. HF

**Edited <time datetime="2014-08-18T10:03:46Z" title="08/18/2014 10:03  AM" data-short="9 yr">August 18, 2014</time> by boolybooly**
I just noticed, On the front page it doesn't say Utilikerbal distinction on the falcon b, when it launched the Cube sat.

> GoSlash27, did that land safely? (second screen has a preflight timecode FYI)

Yessir. No runs, no drips, no errors.

 I think the clock reset because I went EVA for the photo op.

Best,

-Slashy

Thanks for explaining GoSlash27. Congratulations on completing the K-Prize mission with the innovative ion powered EVE express.

is "space planes plus" conciderd stock now? ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Are you trying to tell us something djnekkid? Would you like to publish a gatecrasher?

Thanks for your mission report RocketScientistV and congratulations for completing another K-Prize winning mission, with a safe landing at the KSC runway earning the highly regarded Advanced Pilot Precision Award with Manley... a touching tribute to the enthusiastic Scott?

Hi all

Way back in 0.21 I entered the Spider Mk v

Here is the Spider Mk XVI

Spaceplane:- Spider Mk XVI

Cost:- wet 218688 Dry 214494

Weight Wet 71092 KG Dry 29062 KG

Has 6000 Dv if full of fuel in orbit

Parts 309 including the Rover, Can fly by itself without rover as it has a probe core

All Stock no mods or part clipping

**Edited <time datetime="2014-08-24T09:11:16Z" title="08/24/2014 09:11  AM" data-short="9 yr">August 24, 2014</time> by Gravaar**

> is "space planes plus" conciderd stock now? ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

> 
> Are you trying to tell us something djnekkid? Would you like to publish a gatecrasher?

Not sure if boolybooly knows about it, But the mod Space planes plus is being made stock with ksp! It was announced Tuesday i think it was. I think djnekkid was asking if we are allowed to use those parts from the mod as if they are stock or will we have to wait for that update to come out with the sp+ parts in the stock install...

Spaceplane+ will be stock when Spaceplane+ will be stock ;-b

They said the pack will be slightly modified, so craft with Sp+ mod parts probably will not be compatible with .25

And who knows what they plan to change...

After a long, long time working on my SSTO SpacePlanes, I may have come up with one that actually meets the challenge!

Will post later, IF I manage to land it hehe ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Look I just "found" it painted like this and me and the others took it out for a spin

Yes ...yes ...I know now we hafta get the other 9 back from orbit but I told em if they wasn't back by the time the sat was deployed I wasn't waiting for em

And anyway watta ya mean it aint stock? I found it like that !!!

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/1Cayb)

STATS:- Mod Spaceplane +

10 Kerbals to orbit (pilot + 9 others)

cargobay with sat loaded

4 turbojets and 2 aerospikes

**Edited <time datetime="2014-08-25T13:55:46Z" title="08/25/2014 01:55  PM" data-short="9 yr">August 25, 2014</time> by Gravaar**

Question before I make my challenge attempt: I know it has to be all stock parts (which means no Spaceplane Plus, even if it's future stock), but does it have to be stock aerodynamics too? I currently have FAR installed and don't want to go breaking the rules.

I usually play with <abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr>, but since I've been testing stuff and doing a few challenges in stock aero lately I figured I should get my K Prize while I was at it.

The Kolibri: 6.5t, capacity: 1 kerb; One turbojet, two intakes; two Rockomax 78-7S. <abbr title="Liquid Fuel">LF</abbr>:381 Ox:283 plus the 7.5 monoprop built into the cockpit for docking manoeuvres.

![screenshot0.png](http://s30.postimg.org/u2coj2k6p/screenshot0.png)

>

tl;dr: to 70.5km orbit with small probe payload, docking with station at 80km, return to landing on runway 27.

**Edited <time datetime="2018-04-17T17:30:09Z" title="04/17/2018 05:30  PM" data-short="6 yr">April 17, 2018</time> by cakepie**

Ok, so you may disqualify me for this... but.

1 launch, 3 landings. 

Yea, I uncoupled but ONLY after I achieved orbit. Consider the two outer ones to be ummm... payload. Yea, payload.

![Xprise1.png](http://www.datainterlock.com/Kerbal/Xprise1.png)

![Xprise2.png](http://www.datainterlock.com/Kerbal/Xprise2.png)

![Xprise3.png](http://www.datainterlock.com/Kerbal/Xprise3.png)

![Xprise4.png](http://www.datainterlock.com/Kerbal/Xprise4.png)

![Xprise5.png](http://www.datainterlock.com/Kerbal/Xprise5.png)

Sorry Samniss Arandeen... FAR is currently treated as non stock so it doesn't qualify for a K-Prize.

Congrats cake>pie on your Advanced Pilot Precision Award 1st Class.

Fengist did the middle craft make it to orbit without using the thrusters or fuel on the "payload" craft?

Gravaar did you want a gatecrasher link for your second? With a successful K-Prize mission you have the right to choose to have the gatecrasher removed or linked.

> 
> Fengist did the middle craft make it to orbit without using the thrusters or fuel on the "payload" craft?

Well, you see, the fuel and thrusters WAS the ummm payload and I had to make sure they worked properly. I mean I wouldn't want to detach those two guys and have them try to fly home with engines that don't work. That would be ummm silly.

But hey, they were all one plane when they went up, they just came down at different times.

> 
> Gravaar did you want a gatecrasher link for your second? With a successful K-Prize mission you have the right to choose to have the gatecrasher removed or linked.

Yep Gatecrasher for the second

And The entry was Spider Mk. 16

the Spider Mk. 5 was entered way back in 0.21 ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Congrats cake>pie on your Advanced Pilot Precision Award 1st Class.

I brought a payload too, should be good for Utilitarial Commendation, right?
